Work Blog Me
May 1, 2016 • work, audio

What's next for the humble fairground?

Project Profile

I looked into the history of fairground in the UK, and whether they're being replaced by modern, high-tech rides.

Quick facts

  • Spoke to theme park and traditional fairground operators
  • Rode the largest transportable fairground ride in the UK (several times)

Prompted by the sudden appearance of the Star Flier in Sheffield city centre one day in early 2016, I explored the history of these enormous transportable thrill rides, and what their proliferation means for the traditional funfairs of our childhoods.

During my investigation, I came across Carters’ Steam Fair, who restore and operate original Victorian rides, touring around the south of England every summer.
